p: Of the 547/685 (80%) in-migrants, who were newly detected HIV cases and for whom a place of origin was known, 281 (51%) originated from within the Rakai District. Of those infections originating outside Rakai ( n = 266), 51% ( n = 136) were from Masaka District, 16% ( n = 42) from Tanzania (all from the neighboring Kagera District), and 8% ( n = 22) from Kampala (Fig. 3b). HIV-prevalence among all in-migrants from outside Rakai by place of origin ( n = 1138) is shown in Fig. 3c and was the highest at 28% (95% CI: 20–37%) among those from Tanzania.
